intro: Spermacoce spicata, commonly known as the spiked horsegram, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are typically green when immature and turn black when ripe. Spermacoce spicata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
